meanings.definition: To convert text into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: She was romanising the ancient script for easier reading.
meanings.sent2: The translator was romanising the document for a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he started romanising his name in different fonts.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts in romanising the text brought clarity to the historical document.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's method of romanising the text made it accessible to all students.

meanings.definition: To make something Roman in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The architect was romanising the building's design with columns and arches.
meanings.sent2: She was romanising the party decorations with laurel wreaths and togas.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly suggested romanising the office with a toga day.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes romanising the painting gave it a classical feel.
meanings.sent5: The chef's use of Roman spices was romanising the dish, giving it an authentic taste.
